intro: Neobartsia adenophylla, commonly known as the hairy-leaved neobartsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Commelinaceae family, which includes plants known for their showy flowers and aquatic adaptations. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lanceolate leaves that are densely covered with fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Neobartsia adenophylla thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
